sample.datamodel

Class Movie

  • java.lang.Object
    • sample.datamodel.Movie

  • public class Movie
extends java.lang.Object
    The Movie class represents a move. It contains all the information that is available in the movieproject.db file including the directors, actors and genres of the movie. The fields utilize the Simple...Property classes which makes databinding in JavaFX convenient.

    • Method Detail

      • addDirector

        public void addDirector(Director director)
        This method adds a director to the movie object. Depending on whether it is the first director added or not the directorNames property which displays the directors in the GUI has to be updated differently. This method is called from the MovieData class which is responsible for loading all the movie objects.
        Parameters:
        director - The director object that should be added to the movie object.

      • addActor

        public void addActor(Actor actor)
        This method adds an actor to the movie object. Depending on whether it is the first actor added or not the actorNames property which displays the actors in the GUI has to be updated differently. This method is called from the MovieData class which is responsible for loading all the movie objects.
        Parameters:
        actor - The actor object that should be added to the movie object.

      • addGenres

        public void addGenres(java.util.List<java.lang.String> genres)
        This method adds the genres to the movie object. This method is called from the MovieData class which is responsible for loading all the movie objects.
        Parameters:
        genres - A List that contains all the genres that can be attributed to the movie object.

      • setPlotDescription

        public void setPlotDescription(java.lang.String plotDescription)
        Sets the plot description of the movie object. If no plot description is available in the movieproject.db file it will set the description to n/a.
        Parameters:
        plotDescription - A description of the plot of the movie.

      • getPlotDescription

        public java.lang.String getPlotDescription()
        Gets the value of the property plotDescription.

      • plotDescriptionProperty

        public javafx.beans.property.SimpleStringProperty plotDescriptionProperty()
        See Also:
        getPlotDescription(), setPlotDescription(String)

      • setReleaseDate

        public void setReleaseDate(java.lang.String releaseDateString)
        Sets the release date of the movie object. The inputFormatter is responsible for parsing the date from the movieproject.db file, the outputFormatter decides in which format the date will be displayed in the GUI. If the input String cannot be parsed it will set the release date to n/a.
        Parameters:
        releaseDateString - The release date of the movie in String format.

      • getReleaseDateString

        public java.lang.String getReleaseDateString()

      • setCurrentUserRating

        public void setCurrentUserRating(double currentUserRating)
        Sets the rating that the user currently logged in has given the movie. 1. Method is called when the program loads in interactive mode from the MovieData class in order to retrieve the ratings that were saved for the user. 2. Method is called when the user enters a new rating in the GUI in order to update the rating that is displayed.
        Parameters:
        currentUserRating - The rating that the current user has given the movie or a numerical code if there is no information in the data or the user has entered invalid input.

      • getCurrentUserRating

        public double getCurrentUserRating()
